1.text: Understand the anatomy of a balloon.

5.text: Pinch the balloon’s neck between the index and middle fingers on one hand.

6.text: Pull the lip toward you with your non-pinching hand.

7.text: Loop the stretched length of neck over the top of your pinching hand's thumb and index finger.

8.text: Transfer the lip from the looping hand to your wrapped-up finger and thumb.

9.text: Pull the lip backward through the loop you’re created.

10.text: Allow the loop to slide forward off your fingers.

11.text: Stretch the opening of the balloon's lip around the faucet.

13.text: Remove the water balloon from the faucet, with its neck between the index and middle fingers of one hand.

14.text: Grab the lip with your free hand and loop the balloon’s neck over the top of your pinching hand's thumb and index finger.

15.text: Pass the lip from your looping hand to your wrapped-up finger and thumb.

16.text: Retract the lip, along with your finger and thumb, backward through the loop that's wrapped up around them.

17.text: Allow the loop to slide forward, off your fingers.
